net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.data

Interface TreeModel

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DragAndDropTreeModel
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTreeModel, DataColumnTreeModel, TableToTreeModelAdapter, TreeNodeTreeModel

    public interface TreeModel

    Defines the model for a Tree.

    The objects used as nodes in the TreeModel may be any object. The objects however must implement the Object.equals() and Object.hashCode() methods. Most classes in the standard Java libraries do this, but you must check to make sure. Please also read the contract in Object for equals() and hashCode(). Unimplemented or incorrect implementations will cause problems with the Tree, such as failure to expand or collapse nodes.

    Nodes are not cached by MIWT. The implementor of TreeModel must make sure the class is efficient.

    The TreeNodeTreeModel provides a full TreeModel implementation using TreeNode objects. The TreeNode object has a custom object property that can be used to hold application specific information. This class is useful for relatively small trees.

    The AbstractTreeModel class implements helper methods for event firing. If TreeNodeTreeModel does provide sufficient functionality, then it is recommended to extend AbstractTreeModel as event firing methods are already provided. Some other methods are also implemented.

    The TreeModelValidator class may be used to validate the implementation of a tree model. It will catch most problems with an implementation.

    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Method Detail

      • addTreeModelListener

        void addTreeModelListener(TreeModelListener l)
        Adds a listener for the TreeModelEvent posted after the tree changes.
        Parameters:
        l - The TreeModelListener.

      • canColumnSort

        boolean canColumnSort(int columnIndex)
        Determine if a column can be sorted. Sorting must be implemented in a subclass, the Tree will not perform sorting.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The index of the column, zero being the first column.
        Returns:
        true if the column can be sorted, false otherwise.

      • fireTreeChanged

        void fireTreeChanged(TreeModelEvent event)
        Fire a tree model event.
        Parameters:
        event - the event.

      • getChild

        Object getChild(Object parent,
              int index)
        Returns the child of parent at index index in the parent's child array. The parent object will either by the object returned by the root node or from a previous call to the getChild() method.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent object.
        index - The index of the child.
        Returns:
        The child object.

      • getChildCount

        int getChildCount(Object parent)
        Returns the number of children of parent. The parent object will either by the object returned by the root node or from a previous call to the getChild() method.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent object.
        Returns:
        The number of children at this node.

      • getColumnClass

        Class<?> getColumnClass(int columnIndex)
        Returns the most specific superclass for all the cell values in the column. This will be used to select default cell renders and editors.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The index of the column, zero being the first column.
        Returns:
        The Class of the column.

      • getColumnCount

        int getColumnCount()
        Returns the number of columns in the model.
        Returns:
        The number of columns.

      • getColumnName

        TextSource getColumnName(int columnIndex)
        Returns the name of the column at columnIndex.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The index of the column, zero being the first column.
        Returns:
        The column name.

      • getColumnOrdering

        SortOrder getColumnOrdering(int columnIndex)
        Get the ordering of the column.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The index of the column, zero being the first column.
        Returns:
        An SortOrder instance indicating the current sort order for the column.

      • getIndexOfChild

        int getIndexOfChild(Object parent,
                  Object child)
        Returns the index of child in parent. The parent and child objects will either by the object returned by the root node or from a previous call to the getChild() method.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent object.
        child - The child object.
        Returns:
        The index of the child in the parent.

      • getNodeId

        String getNodeId(Object node)

        Get an unique ID for the node. This ID will be used in some mediums to find the node in the case where the model and user interface become inconsistent.

        This method may return null if not supported.

        Parameters:
        node - The tree node.
        Returns:
        String or null if no ID is available.

      • getRoot

        Object getRoot()
        Returns the root of the tree.
        Returns:
        The root.

      • getValueAt

        Object getValueAt(TreePath path,
                int columnIndex)
        Returns the value for the cell at columnIndex and path. Column zero should return an object that is either the same or equal to the object returned by getChild() or equivalently path. getLastPathComponent().
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the node.
        columnIndex - The index of the column, zero being the first column.
        Returns:
        The value object.

      • isCellEditable

        boolean isCellEditable(TreePath path,
                     int columnIndex)
        Returns true if the cell at path and columnIndex is editable.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the node.
        columnIndex - The index of the column, zero being the first column.
        Returns:
        true if the cell may be edited.

      • isColumnFirstOrdered

        boolean isColumnFirstOrdered(int columnIndex)
        Determine if the column is the first ordered column.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The index of the column, zero being the first column.
        Returns:
        true if the column is the primary ordering.

      • isLeaf

        boolean isLeaf(Object node)
        Returns true if node is a leaf. If this method returns true then it is assumed this node cannot have children. No calls to getChildCount() or getChild() will be made. In most medium implementations, nodes that return true will not have an expand/collapse control, nodes that return false may always have an expand collapse control, but may have no child nodes.
        Parameters:
        node - The object to check.
        Returns:
        true if the node cannot have children.

      • removeTreeModelListener

        void removeTreeModelListener(TreeModelListener l)
        Removes a listener previously added with addTreeModelListener(). If the listener was not previously added, no action is taken.
        Parameters:
        l - The listener.

      • setOrderedColumn

        void setOrderedColumn(int columnIndex)
        Set the ordered column. If the column is already ordered, toggle the ordering mode, otherwise sort SortOrder.ASCENDING.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The index of the column, zero being the first column.

      • setOrderedColumn

        void setOrderedColumn(int columnIndex,
                    SortOrder order)
        Sets the column for ordering and an explicit order mode. If the model does not support this, an empty implementation is sufficient. However, no sorting will be performed.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The column index for ordering
        order - The order mode.

      • setValueAt

        void setValueAt(@Nullable
              Object aValue,
              TreePath path,
              int columnIndex)
        Sets the value in the cell at columnIndex and path to aValue
        Parameters:
        aValue - The new value for the column.
        path - The path to the node.
        columnIndex - The index of the column, zero being the first column.

      • valueForPathChanged

        void valueForPathChanged(TreePath path,
                       @Nullable
                       Object newValue)
        Messaged when the user has altered the value for the item identified by path to newValue.
        Parameters:
        path - The path to the node that has changes.
        newValue - The new value for the node.
